intro: Xylopia gossweileri, commonly known as the African star anise, is a tropical evergreen tree belonging to the family Annonaceae. It is native to central and western Africa, where it thrives in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its fruit is a star-shaped, five-lobed berry that contains several seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The tree also plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
